Preventing users from copying content is a complex issue, and there are several approaches that can be used depending on the specific use case. Here are a few examples of techniques that can be used: 1. Watermarking: One approach is to add a watermark to the content to make it harder to copy or reuse. Watermarks can be added to images, videos, or other types of content, and can include information such as the copyright owner, the date, or a unique identifier. Here's an example code snippet for adding a text watermark to an image using the Python Pillow library: ```makefile from PIL import Image from PIL import ImageDraw from PIL import ImageFont # Open the image file image = Image.open("example.jpg") # Create a drawing object draw = ImageDraw.Draw(image) # Choose a font and font size for the watermark font = ImageFont.truetype("arial.ttf", 36) # Set the text and color for the watermark text = "Copyright RealEstateMall" color = (255, 255, 255, 128) # Get the size of the text and the image text_size = draw.textsize(text, font) image_size = image.size # Calculate the position of the watermark x = image_size[0] - text_size[0] - 10 y = image_size[1] - text_size[1] - 10 # Add the watermark to the image draw.text((x, y), text, font=font, fill=color) # Save the watermarked image to a file image.save("example_watermarked.jpg") ``` 2. DRM (Digital Rights Management): Another approach is to use Digital Rights Management (DRM) technology to restrict access to the content. DRM typically involves encrypting the content and controlling access to it through a licensing system. 3. Disable Copy/Paste: It's possible to disable the copy and paste function in web pages, although this is not foolproof since users can still take screenshots or use other methods to capture the content. Here's an example code snippet for disabling the right-click context menu and keyboard shortcuts in a web page: ```html Example Page

This is an example paragraph.

``` Keep in mind that these techniques can make it harder for users to copy content, but they are not foolproof and determined users can still find ways to copy or steal content.
